# Bank Management System - UML Diagrams

This document contains the UML diagrams for the Bank Management System project.

## 1. Use Case Diagram

```{mermaid}
graph LR
    subgraph Actors
        Customer((Customer))
        Administrator((Administrator))
    end

    subgraph "Banking System"
        Login(Login)
        Register(Register)
        Logout(Logout)
        
        ViewDash(View Dashboard)
        UpdProf(Update Profile)
        SendMon(Send Money)
        ViewHist(View Transaction History)
        
        AdminDash(Admin Dashboard)
        ViewCust(View All Customers)
        ManTran(Manage Transactions)
        EditCust(Edit Customer)
        DelCust(Delete Customer)
        AddCust(Add Customer)
        ViewAllTran(View All Transactions)
    end

    Customer --> Login
    Customer --> Register
    Customer --> Logout
    Customer --> ViewDash
    Customer --> UpdProf
    Customer --> SendMon
    Customer --> ViewHist

    Administrator --> Login
    Administrator --> Logout
    Administrator --> AdminDash
    Administrator --> ViewCust
    Administrator --> ManTran
    Administrator --> EditCust
    Administrator --> DelCust
    Administrator --> AddCust
    Administrator --> ViewAllTran
    
    %% Styling to mimic Use Case diagram
    classDef actorStyle fill:#fff,stroke:#333,stroke-width:2px;
    class Customer,Administrator actorStyle;
    
    classDef ucStyle fill:#f9f9f9,stroke:#333,stroke-width:1px,rx:10,ry:10;
    class Login,Register,Logout,ViewDash,UpdProf,SendMon,ViewHist,AdminDash,ViewCust,ManTran,EditCust,DelCust,AddCust,ViewAllTran ucStyle;
```

## 2. Class Diagram

```{mermaid}
classDiagram
    class Customer {
        +Customer Name : String
        +Account Number : String
        +Address : String
        +Phone Number : String
        +Email : String
        +CreateAccount()
        +SendMoney()
        +ViewDashboard()
    }

    class Bank {
        +Transaction type : String
        +Transaction date : Date
        +Transaction time : Time
        +Customer details : String
        +Deposit()
        +Withdraw()
        +UpdateDetails()
        +ViewAllTransactions()
    }

    class Account {
        +Account number : String
        +Balance : double
        +Customer Name : String
        +CheckBalance()
        +UpdateBalance()
    }

    Customer --> Bank
    Customer --> Account
```

## 3. Sequence Diagram (Login Scenario)

```{mermaid}
sequenceDiagram
    actor User
    participant Browser
    participant LoginServlet
    participant Database

    User->>Browser: Enter Email & Password
    Browser->>LoginServlet: POST /LoginServlet
    
    activate LoginServlet
    LoginServlet->>Database: getConnection()
    activate Database
    Database-->>LoginServlet: Connection Object
    deactivate Database
    
    LoginServlet->>Database: SELECT * FROM users WHERE email=?
    activate Database
    Database-->>LoginServlet: ResultSet (User Row)
    deactivate Database
    
    alt User Found
        LoginServlet->>LoginServlet: Create Session
        LoginServlet-->>Browser: Redirect to UserDashboard
    else User Not Found
        LoginServlet-->>Browser: Redirect to Login?error=true
    end
    deactivate LoginServlet
```

## 4. Sequence Diagram (Send Money Scenario)

```{mermaid}
sequenceDiagram
    participant User
    participant SendMoneyServlet
    participant Database

    note right of User: This represents the interaction flow\nfor sending money between accounts.
    
    User->>SendMoneyServlet: 1. Request Send Money (POST)
    
    activate SendMoneyServlet
    SendMoneyServlet->>Database: 2. Check Balance (SELECT)
    activate Database
    Database-->>SendMoneyServlet: 3. Return Balance
    deactivate Database
    
    SendMoneyServlet->>Database: 4. Deduct Sender (UPDATE)
    activate Database
    Database-->>SendMoneyServlet: 5. Confirm Update
    deactivate Database
    
    SendMoneyServlet->>Database: 6. Add Receiver (UPDATE)
    activate Database
    Database-->>SendMoneyServlet: 7. Confirm Update
    deactivate Database
    
    SendMoneyServlet->>Database: 8. Log Transaction (INSERT)
    activate Database
    Database-->>SendMoneyServlet: 9. Confirm Insert
    deactivate Database
    
    SendMoneyServlet-->>User: 10. Redirect Success
    deactivate SendMoneyServlet
```

## 5. Collaboration Diagram (Send Money Scenario)

```{mermaid}
graph TD
    %% Nodes
    Sender[Sender Costumer]
    App[Banking App / Interface]
    DB[Database Server]
    Receiver[Receiver Account]
    Log[Transaction Log]

    %% Layout hints
    %% We connect them to the Central Hub (App) to mimic the Star shape
    
    Sender --- App
    App --- DB
    App --- Receiver
    App --- Log

    %% Messages matching the flow
    linkStyle 0 stroke-width:2px,fill:none
    linkStyle 1 stroke-width:2px,fill:none
    linkStyle 2 stroke-width:2px,fill:none
    linkStyle 3 stroke-width:2px,fill:none
    
    %% Directional Arrows for the messages
    Sender -- "1: Enter Amount & PIN" --> App
    App -- "2: Validate Balance" --> DB
    DB -. "3: Balance OK" .-> App
    App -- "4: Credit Receiver" --> Receiver
    App -- "5: Save Record" --> Log
    App -- "6: Display Choice/Receipt" --> Sender

    %% Styling to match the blue box style of the image
    classDef blueBox fill:#e1f5fe,stroke:#01579b,stroke-width:2px,color:black;
    class Sender,App,DB,Receiver,Log blueBox;
```

## 6. Activity Diagram (Transaction Process)

```{mermaid}
flowchart TD
    start((Start)) --> input[User Inputs Receiver & Amount]
    input --> check{Check Balance}
    
    check -- Sufficient --> deduct[Deduct Amount from Sender]
    check -- Insufficient --> error[Show Error Message] --> stop((End))
    
    deduct --> add[Add Amount to Receiver]
    add --> log[Log Transaction in DB]
    log --> success[Show Success Message]
    success --> stop
```

## 7. State Chart Diagram (User Session State)

```{mermaid}
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> LoggedOut
    
    LoggedOut --> LoggedIn : Login Success
    LoggedOut --> LoggedOut : Login Failure
    
    state LoggedIn {
        [*] --> Dashboard
        Dashboard --> PerformingAction : User clicks Action
        PerformingAction --> Dashboard : Action Complete
    }
    
    LoggedIn --> LoggedOut : Logout Clicked
    LoggedIn --> SessionExpired : Inactivity Timeout
    SessionExpired --> LoggedOut : Relogin Required
```

## 9. Deployment Diagram

```{mermaid}
graph TD
```
